intro: Cnidoscolus neglectus, commonly known as the Mexican bristleleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with unique morphological features. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are often covered in fine, stiff hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is also notable for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its use in traditional medicine.
